radiographic_examinations.findings: Initial chest X-ray displayed a right upper lobe opacification. A repeat chest X-ray 24 hours after admission revealed complete right upper lobe, right lower and left mid-basal opacification, with diffuse thickening of the bilateral lower-middle lung.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Progression from right upper lobe opacification to complete opacification of the right upper lobe, right lower lobe, and left mid-basal region over 24 hours.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Confirmed the right upper lobe opacification with a suspected air bubble inside, excluding pulmonary embolism or aortic dissection.
